alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 18 at 4:04PM ChST until January 22 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM FRIDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH 6 AM MONDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO 6 AM MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 13 to 16 feet extremely dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...West, north, and east facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 6 AM Friday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 AM Friday to 6 AM Monday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through 6 AM Monday. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large northerly swell will gradually shift to north-northeast Friday while decreasing slightly. This should allow surf to decrease on west facing reefs Friday but increase on east facing reefs. Surf heights should ultimately fall below 15 foot `dangerous` levels early Friday, but remain `hazardous` through Sunday night.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.
